JobDescription: A UI/UX (User Interface/User Experience) designer is responsible for designing and creating engaging and effective interfaces for software and web applications. This includes designing the layout, visual design, and interactivity of the user interface.
JobResponsibility: Collaborating with cross-functional teams: UI/UX designers often work closely with other teams, including product management, engineering, and marketing, to ensure that the user interface is aligned with business and technical requirements. You will need to be able to effectively communicate your design ideas and gather feedback from other team members.
EducationaRequirements: Bachelor degree to complete any reputational university.

EducationaRequirements: Bachelor degree to complete any reputational university.

JobDescription: Software engineering is an engineering-based approach to software development. A software engineer is a person who applies the engineering design process to design, develop, maintain, test, and evaluate computer software.
JobResponsibility: research, design and write new software programs (e.g. business applications or computer games) and computer operating systems.
EducationaRequirements: Most software engineering jobs require at least a bachelor's degree,

JobDescription: A Project Engineer is a professional who is responsible for all technical and engineering aspects of their assigned projects
JobResponsibility: Preparing, scheduling, coordinating and monitoring the assigned engineering projects.
EducationaRequirements: A bachelor's degree in a relevant field, at least five years of experience and an active PE license is preferred.

JobDescription: A Front-End Developer is responsible for developing new user-facing features, determining the structure and design of web pages, building reusable codes, optimizing page loading times, and using a variety of markup languages to create the web pages.
JobResponsibility: Use markup languages like HTML to create user-friendly web pages.Maintain and improve website.
EducationaRequirements: Front-end developers need a minimum of a bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field

JobDescription: Network Engineers are responsible for ensuring that networks have maximum uptime,
JobResponsibility: Establishes and maintains network performance. Builds net configurations and connections.
EducationaRequirements: Since most network engineer positions require at least a bachelor's degree, it usually takes around four years to become a network engineer
